newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Kia Motors June sales up 73 pct.
newsitem.headline: Kia Motors June sales up 73 pct.

text.p: Kia Motors Corp, one of South Korea's three largest carmakers, said on Tuesday its vehicle sales in June rose 73 percent to 67,746 units from 39,125 units a year earlier.
A Kia statement said Kia's vehicle exports jumped 343 percent to 40,093 units from 9,048 units a year ago, when a wildcat strike hampered shipments.
However, Kia's domestic sales fell eight percent to 27,653 units from 30,077 units.
A Kia official said the introduction of new passenger cars by Daewoo Motors had eroded Kia's sales at home.
He said Kia's domestic sales would improve in the second half with the advent of its new models, including a new version of its Sephia compact car.
